com.esri.mo2.src.cat
Class ContextMenuProvider

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.src.cat.ContextMenuProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
MenuProvider
Direct Known Subclasses:
FeatureClassMenuProvider
public abstract class ContextMenuProvider
extends Object
implements MenuProvider

Defines a plugin interface for pluggable context (popup) menus within the Catalog, based on the available content-types defined by a ContentProvider. Plug-in context menus are managed within the BaseContentProvider class.

The menus should be constructed within the implementation of getMenus. It is recommended to populate the menus using subclasses of ContextMenuAction in order for the action to receive information about the affected Content.

Implementors of ContentProvider have several different options for customizing the context menus:

  • construct a subclass of ContextMenuProvider and construct new or replacement menus for a given content-type (populate using ContentMenuAction)
  • construct a subclass of ContextMenuProvider and modify an existing menu for a given content-type
  • over-ride performAction() in subclasses of BaseContent that the ContentProvider constructs and handle the ContentAction in any way deemed suitable
Unlike regular menus based upon JMenu, only one JMenu will be used as a context menu for a particular Content. The menu chosen will be based on the JMenu "name" returned by invoking JMenu.getText(). This name will be compared with the available content types defined by the Content, and a suitable menu chosen. For example if a context menu is defined with name "com.esri.mo2.data.feat.FeatureClass" then it will be shown as the context menu for Content objects that represent FeatureClass objects, such as Shapefiles and ArcSDE layers.

Whilst this is "pure user interface" it is necessary to define it within the catalog model because implementations of ContentProvider must provide Content that responds to actions from the Catalog ui. It is expected that such actions will never be signalled within a non-user interface application such as a server application.
